message.entry: 1. Remove the memory card from the host\ncomputer and insert into the Raspberry Pi hardware.
2. Connect an Ethernet cable to the board. Connect\nthe other end of the Ethernet cable to your LAN\nor HOME network.
2. Connect an Ethernet cable to the board. Connect\nthe other end of the Ethernet cable directly to the\nhost computer.
2. Connect an Ethernet cable to the board. Connect\nthe other end of the Ethernet cable to your network.
3. Connect a 5V micro USB power supply to the\nboard. The power supply should be rated for at\nleast 700 mA.
Make sure that the 'PWR' LED is solid red and\nthe '%s' LED indicating SD card activity\nstarts blinking. Then, click 'Next' to continue.
NOTE: You may connect optional peripherals such\nas a monitor, keyboard, etc. at this time.

Could not delete the IP address entry in the ~/.ssh/known_hosts for the detected Raspberry Pi.\n Please remove the IP address entry manually from ~/.ssh/known_hosts file if there are any issues with the SSH connection.

The firmware update process for Raspberry Pi hardware consists of copying a
Raspbian Wheezy Linux firmware image onto a memory card and booting the
Raspberry Pi board with this memory card. We will guide you through this process.
Select your board to get started.
Insert a 4 GB or larger %s memory card into a memory card reader on the host computer.\n\nSelect the drive letter that corresponds to the memory card reader:
If you do not find the memory card reader in the list of drives, reinsert the memory card fully\nand click "Refresh".\n
Insert a 4 GB or larger %s memory card into a memory card reader on the host computer.\n\nSelect the Volume that corresponds to the memory card reader:
If you do not find the memory card reader in the list of Volumes \n reinsert the memory card fully and click "Refresh".\n
You chose to write to %s. The write operation\n may take several minutes.
WARNING: All data in the memory card will be erased!
\n\nConfigure IP settings for wired Ethernet connection
If you want to log in to the board in the future, the host name,\n IP address, user name, and password are displayed below.
NOTE:\n 1. Your Raspberry Pi hardware will speak its IP address \n through the analog audio connector when it boots.

2. You can configure your Raspberry Pi hardware to automatically 
 send an e-mail when IP address changes. 

 Click 'Help' for detailed instructions.
Error downloading firmware. Wait a couple of minutes and try downloading again.
Writing firmware image to SD card...
Identifying network interface cards ({0} seconds left)...
No network interface cards are detected on this computer.
Choose the network interface Raspberry Pi is connected to:
You must choose a network connection.
No write permission to the external SD card. Check if write protection is enabled.
Wired Ethernet interface "{0}" will be reconfigured\nto communicate with Raspberry Pi.

"{0}" must be configured for DHCP to communicate with Raspberry Pi.\nIf you do not want to re-configure this network connection, go back to "Configure network"\nscreen and select a different network configuration.
Error while configuring network card for DHCP: {0}
Error while querying a list of network cards: {0}
The network interface "{0}" is not connected.\nCheck your Ethernet connection to Raspberry Pi.\nThe FDX/LNK/100 LEDs on the Raspberry Pi board should be illuminated.

Could not detect a Raspberry Pi board on "{0}". Wait for 30 seconds and try repeating this step again.\nIf this does not work see the "Get the IP Address of the Raspberry Pi Hardware" section in the MATLAB documentation.
Error while adding a route to Raspberry Pi: {0}

Connection test to "{0}" failed. Wait for 30 seconds and repeat the connection test again. If you attempted
the connection test multiple times without success, see the "Troubleshoot Connecting to Raspberry Pi Hardware"
section in the MATLAB documentation. Details of the connection failure:
{1}
Could not detect the Raspberry Pi hardware in allotted time. Try using "Test Connection" button.
Error writing firmware image to the SD card. Firmware write has timed out.\nClick "Back" and try again.

Cannot connect to {0}.
1. Verify that your computer is in the same sub-network with the board.
2. Verify that you do not have a firewall preventing SSH connections.
Details: {1}
Cannot connect to {0}.\nVerify that you do not have a firewall preventing SSH connections.\nDetails: {1}

An error occurred while reading the IP address of the board.
"Automatically get IP address option" in IP settings requires that a
DHCP server be available in your network.
Verify that you have a DHCP server in the network the board
is connected to and repeat this step.
An error occurred while reading the IP address of the board.\nWait a few minutes and try this step again.
Error opening serial port {0}. Verify that no other application is using this serial port.
Press and hold "USER" button and press and release "RESET" button.\nClick 'Next' to continue.
Error writing firmware to the memory card: {0}

There was a problem querying removable drives that require
 Windows administrative privileges. Restart MATLAB with
 "Run as administrator" privileges and re-attempt the
 support package installation.
Unable to access the memory card. If you removed the memory card from the computer, re-insert it and repeat this operation.
Firmware image in the selected folder is corrupt.
Cannot find the firmware image file {0} in the selected folder.
Input argument must be a character array.
{0} is not a valid IP address.
The User name cannot be an empty character vector.
Cannot install target. \nNo target with name {0} is installed.
Invalid Board name. Board name must be between 1 and 63 characters long.
Invalid host name. Host name must be composed of ASCII letters ('a-z', 'A-Z'), the digits ('0-9'),\nand the hyphen ('-') and must be between 1 and 63 characters long.
The support package contains an invalid manifest file. Download and install a new support package.
Cannot reinstall {0}. \nThe installation folder, {1}, is not writable.\nMake the folder permissions writable and try again.
The installation folder cannot be empty.
The installation folder name contains a space character.\nCreate or use a folder name that does not contain any space characters.
The installation folder is not writable. Choose a folder with write permissions.
The installation folder cannot be a UNC path.\nUse a mapped network drive instead.
The configuration must be either 'debug' or 'release'.

Could not connect to the board specified. Please check that:
1: The IP address, User name, and Password are valid.
2: The board is powered on and connected to the network

Details:
{0}
"{0}" contains invalid characters. Use only alpha-numeric characters. Please check the {1} provided.
The selected folder contains invalid characters.\nFolder names can only contain alphanumeric characters, dashes and underscores.
Error getting support package information from mathworks.com.\nYour network connection may be down or your proxy settings improperly configured.
Cannot find the file containing firmware information:\n"{0}"\nThis file has either been deleted or moved to a different location. Re-install the support package to get the required files.
Corrupted firmware information file: \n"{0}"\nRe-install the support package to get the required files.
Corrupted firmware image. Re-install the support package to get the latest firmware.
Help directory for the support package is missing. Reinstall the support package or contact MathWorks Technical support.

The following error occurred during the installation of SSHPASS utility: 

 {0}
Manually install the SSHPASS utility and continue with the installation
of the support package.

The firmware update process for Raspberry Pi hardware consists of
copying a Raspbian Wheezy Linux firmware image onto a memory card
and booting the Raspberry Pi board with this memory card. We will
guide you through this process.
Select your board to get started.

Insert a 4 GB or larger %s memory card into a
memory card reader on the host computer.

Select the drive letter that corresponds to the
memory card reader:

If you do not find the memory card reader in the list
of drives, reinsert the memory card fully and
click "Refresh".
No SD card with FAT-32 partition found.\nInsert an SD card (4Gb atleast) with FAT-32 partition.\nRestart the setup process.
No SD card with FAT-32 partition found.\nInsert an SD card (4Gb atleast) with FAT-32 partition.
Download the MathWorks customized Raspbian image to proceed with the hardware setup.
Browse to the downloaded zip file and click on validate button
Extracting and validating the Raspbian image
Browse and select MathWorks Raspbian img
Please select a valid MathWorks Raspbian zip file
The Raspbian image downloaded is not supported by this Support package. Please download the correct version
Cannot find the specified img file
Cannot find the required xml file
MathWorks customized Raspbian image corresponding to this release will be downloaded from the github

If you do not have the Raspbian Image listed here, download it by clicking the link given in the table. Then click Next to validate the downloaded file.

Note:
If you already have the Raspbian image listed here, click Next to validate the same.

Browse and select the downloaded MathWorks Raspbian zip file. Click on Validate button to extract the zip and validate the image.

Note:
If you have already extracted the zip file, please browse and select the img file and then click Validate
